intro: Lamyra glabella, commonly known as the smooth lamyra, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Lamyra glabella is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, thriving in full sun. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in horticulture.
